result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jacob P. Achterberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob P. Achterberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob P. Achterberg was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Comply with bond.
Successfully complete 1 year term of probation.
Participate in recommended mental health treatment, Anger Management and Domestic Abuse Counseling and provide written verification to Oneida County DA's office.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Attend parenting class at Crescent School
Take all medications as prescribed in dosage and manner as prescribed
Continue with counseling
Maintain all appointments with medical provider at all times scheduled by provider
Sign/provide all necessary releases to allow PO to monitor medications/medical provider compliance
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob P. Achterberg

records.addlTxt:

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:48 p.m Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he just got back to work - is behind on child support and WPS bill. Defendant states in last week financial situation has improved. Court notes that we are not here on fine review but review of deferred agreement. Pfeifer states that defendant was given extension to provide proof of compliance with Condition 4 - no proof has been provided. Defendant states he has not attended counseling as required by deferred agreement. Defendant states he has been slowed down for 4-1/2 or 5 months due to injury to ankle. Defendant states he just got a referral to see Dr. Steven Meyer at Riverside Clinic. Was unaware of requirement for transitions center. Court informs defendant that he needs to obtain documentation and provide to DA prior to next hearing date. Bail continued. Adj. 3:57 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

3:52 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer statement that no documentation of required counseling has been provided. Magallones - statement to defendant's broken foot - need to reschedule appointments. Pfeifer does not object to adjournment. Court extends agreement until next review date. Bail continued. Adj. 3:54 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

2:56 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 3 to disorderly conduct, a violation of 947.01 - a Class B Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 4 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Deferred Entry of Judgment filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Count 1 and 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 3 and defers entry of plea on Count 1 and accepts Deferred Entry of Judgment. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence (Count 3)
WHS/POP - 1 year
Court Costs are remitted. 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Attend parenting class at Crescent School. 
Take all medications as prescribed in dosage and manner as prescribed.
Continue with counseling.
Maintain all appointments with medical provider at all times scheduled by provider.
Sign/provide all necessary releases to allow PO to monitor medications/medical provider compliance.
Jail credit - 4 days 
Any other counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO.
Defendant to report to probation - March 2, 2016 in the morning. 
Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 3:24 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

4:39 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees statement - has received proposal. Needs time to speak with client. Bail continued. Adj. 4:45 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:39 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees in receipt of Information- waive further reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Voorhees states there is a tentative resolution. Bail continued. Adj. 3:41 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:34 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Voorhees stipulate that Court base probable cause determination based on reading of police report. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Bail continued. Adj. 3:38 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No abusive contact with Elizabeth A.I. Turgeon. Must make contact with treatment provider relative to counseling and follow-through with counseling.

1:37 p.m. Defendant Jacob P. Achterberg in court, in custody, via video with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Voorhees statement to bond.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Court sets $10,000 sig bond. Adj. 1:45 p.m. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
